revised_title: A New Species of Hard Carbonate of Lime and Oxide of Iron
tldr: The author investigates a new species of hard carbonate of lime and oxide of iron, discovering its unique crystal structures, hardness, and chemical properties. The substance is found to be transparent, phosphorescent, and resistant to fracture, with various crystal forms and angles. The author also discusses its occurrence in natural specimens and its potential confusion with common carbonate of lime.
